intro: Anisolobus salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
